channel.title: Looking for a good, blank source
channel.description:
Hey guys, when I have my own server, I usually just download an old source off the downloads section, make a few edits, and call it my own :|. But I want to change that. :o
I was wondering if anyone can supply me with a completely blank source. I would love for it to be non silabs compatible.
There are only a couple things I request.
If you could, make the starting location in Draynor. Also, if you have the time, make the maximum of each stat 135. (If you can't do these, it's alright. I will learn how, I just need a blank source.)
Thanks guys! ;)
[i]
PS: It's 11PM here, meaning I have to go in a few short minutes. But I will check back tomorrow.[/i]

item.title: Looking for a good, blank source
item.dc:creator: @Ripvayne Ripvayne
item.description:
@Ripvayne wrote:

Thanks very much guys, this really helped.

Read full topic
item.source: Looking for a good, blank source

item.title: Looking for a good, blank source
item.dc:creator: @King_Lingerz King Lingerz
item.description:
@King_Lingerz wrote:

Yeah, going into more detail on what Kiho said, you need to find

   public int getXPForLevel(int level) {
      int points = 0;
      int output = 0;

      for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= level; lvl++) {
         points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0));
         if (lvl >= level) {
            return output;
         }
         output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
      }
      return 0;
   }

   public int getLevelForXP(int exp) {
      int points = 0;
      int output = 0;

      for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 99; lvl++) {
         points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0));
         output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
         if (output >= exp) {
            return lvl;
         }
      }
      return 99;
   }

In your client.java, then change the

<= 99; and return 99;

to

<= 135; and return 135;

So it would end up like this:

   public int getXPForLevel(int level) {
      int points = 0;
      int output = 0;

      for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= level; lvl++) {
         points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0));
         if (lvl >= level) {
            return output;
         }
         output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
      }
      return 0;
   }

   public int getLevelForXP(int exp) {
      int points = 0;
      int output = 0;

      for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 135; lvl++) {
         points += Math.floor((double)lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double)lvl / 7.0));
         output = (int)Math.floor(points / 4);
         if (output >= exp) {
            return lvl;
         }
      }
      return 135;
   }

Changing Start Coords:

Player.java, search the first or both of the coords new players start on when they log in, then edit them to your liking. Hope I helped :]

Read full topic
item.source: Looking for a good, blank source

item.title: Looking for a good, blank source
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

[quote=“sokolscape, post:2, topic:246362”]If you don’t know how to change your starting coords or change the max level then a blank source isn’t your way to go…LMFAO

I really want to say some bad words right now and cuss you out for being so idiotic but i’m doing my best to hold it in…AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH[/quote]

Please leave these forums.

Anyways. You don’t need a blank source, first you go download one, I suggest project Czar because it’s just a great base to work from, you clean it out and work from there.

Also, here’s how to do the stuff that you asked about

1.) Search for your initial coordinates in your player class.
2.) getLevelForXP method.

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for a good, blank source
item.dc:creator: @Ripvayne Ripvayne
item.description:
@Ripvayne wrote:

[quote=“sokolscape, post:2, topic:246362”]If you don’t know how to change your starting coords or change the max level then a blank source isn’t your way to go…LMFAO

I really want to say some bad words right now and cuss you out for being so idiotic but i’m doing my best to hold it in…AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH[/quote]

Yea, I’m the idiotic one. At least I know that everyone starts somewhere, and atleast I am trying. Your flaming means nothing to me.
This is why people complain so much about the MoparScape community. Nobody can ask for some assistance
without being called idiotic. Let me tell you something, I am probably for more intellegent than you.
Just because I am lacking a few Java skills means nothing, you didn’t have to waste your time posting your idiotic reply.

Like I said:

(If you can’t do these, it’s alright. I will learn how, I just need a blank source.)

As you can see, I said I would do them myself if nobody can help me. I am still learning, and I do think a blank source is my way to go. Grow up, and gtfo.

I promise you, give me a blank source, and some time. And I will make a source far better than your aweful-ass excuse for a server.

Read full topic
